info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 11:15PM EDT until July 19 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Rabun County in northeastern Georgia... Macon County in western North Carolina... * Until 1215 AM EDT. * At 1115 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles east of Hayesville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Franklin, Mountain City, Dillard, Sky Valley, Nantahala Lake, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Burningtown, Kyle, Otto and Rainbow Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
